column2: At eleven o'clock the electric lights came back on.
column3: At eleven o'clock the electric lights came back on.

column2: I went into the lounge.
column3: I went into the lounge.

column2: It was deserted.
column3: It was deserted.

column2: By evening we had cleared 200 leagues up the Atlantic.
column3: By evening we had cleared two hundred leagues up the Atlantic.

column2: I repaired to my stateroom.
column3: I repaired to my stateroom.

column2: I couldn't sleep.
column3: I couldn't sleep.

column2: Always at incalculable speed! Always amid the High Arctic mists!
column3: Always at incalculable speed! Always amid the High Arctic mists!

column2: We're going to escape!
column3: We're going to escape!

column2: I sat up.
column3: I sat up.

column2: When? I asked.
column3: When? I asked.

column2: Tonight.	Tonight.
Yes.	Yes.
Where are we?"
column3: Where are we?"

column2: What land is it?
column3: What land is it?

column2: We'll escape tonight even if the sea swallows us up!"
column3: We'll escape tonight even if the sea swallows us up!"

column2: What's more, the Canadian added, "if they catch me, I'll defend myself, I'll fight to the death."
column3: What's more, the Canadian added, "if they catch me, I'll defend myself, I'll fight to the death."

column2: Then we'll die together, Ned my friend.
column3: Then we'll die together, Ned my friend.

column2: I went out on the platform, where I could barely stand upright against the jolts of the billows. The skies were threatening, but land lay inside those dense mists, and we had to escape.
column3: I went out on the platform, where I could barely stand upright against the jolts of the billows. The skies were threatening, but land lay inside those dense mists, and we had to escape.

column2: No!
column3: No!

column2: It was best not to meet him face to face! Best to try and forget him!
column3: It was best not to meet him face to face! Best to try and forget him!

column2: And yet . . . !
column3: And yet . . . !

column2: At six o'clock I ate supper, but I had no appetite.
column3: At six o'clock I ate supper, but I had no appetite.

column2: At 6:30 Ned Land entered my stateroom.
column3: At six thirty Ned Land entered my stateroom.

column2: He told me:
column3: He told me:

column2: At ten o'clock the moon won't be up yet.
column3: At ten o'clock the moon won't be up yet.

column2: We'll take advantage of the darkness. Come to the skiff.
column3: We'll take advantage of the darkness. Come to the skiff.

column2: My heart was pounding mightily. I couldn't curb its pulsations.
column3: My heart was pounding mightily. I couldn't curb its pulsations.

column2: What was he doing just then?
column3: What was he doing just then?

column2: I listened at the door to his stateroom. I heard the sound of footsteps.
column3: I listened at the door to his stateroom. I heard the sound of footsteps.

column2: I no longer wanted to think. A half hour still to wait!
column3: I no longer wanted to think. A half hour still to wait!

column2: Then a sudden thought terrified me.
column3: Then a sudden thought terrified me.

column2: Captain Nemo had left his stateroom. He was in the same lounge I had to cross in order to escape. There I would encounter him one last time.
column3: Captain Nemo had left his stateroom. He was in the same lounge I had to cross in order to escape. There I would encounter him one last time.

column2: He would see me, perhaps speak to me!
column3: He would see me, perhaps speak to me!

column2: Even so, ten o'clock was about to strike.
column3: Even so, ten o'clock was about to strike.

column2: I opened it gently. The lounge was plunged in profound darkness.
column3: I opened it gently. The lounge was plunged in profound darkness.

column2: O almighty God!	O almighty God!
Enough!"
column3: Enough!"

column2: Let's go, let's go! I exclaimed.
column3: Let's go, let's go! I exclaimed.

column2: Right away! the Canadian replied.
column3: Right away! the Canadian replied.

column2: What was it? Had they spotted our escape?
column3: What was it? Had they spotted our escape?

column2: Yes, I muttered, "we know how to die!"
column3: Yes, I muttered, "we know how to die!"

column2: The Canadian paused in his work.
column3: The Canadian paused in his work.

column2: Maelstrom!	Maelstrom!
Maelstrom!" they were shouting.
column3: Maelstrom!" they were shouting.

column2: The Maelstrom!
column3: The Maelstrom!

column2: What a predicament!
column3: What a predicament!

column2: We were rocking frightfully.
column3: We were rocking frightfully.

column2: Its steel muscles were cracking. Sometimes it stood on end, the three of us along with it!
column3: Its steel muscles were cracking. Sometimes it stood on end, the three of us along with it!

column2: We've got to hold on tight, Ned said, "and screw the nuts down again! If we can stay attached to the Nautilus, we can still make it . . . !"
column3: We've got to hold on tight, Ned said, "and screw the nuts down again! If we can stay attached to the Nautilus, we can still make it . . . !"
